intro: Calligonum elatum, commonly known as the tall sandmat, is a perennial shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, gray-green leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters during the summer months, which are pollinated by insects. Its root system is extensive and deep, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Calligonum elatum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize sandy soils and prevent erosion.
